Member Function Documentation

virtual void sxsdk::renderer_interface::ask ( stream_interface *  stream,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called when the Settings button next to the Method pop-up menu in the Rendering settings is clicked.

To make the Settings button active, override and return true. The advanced rendering settings dialog box is displayed with this function.

Parameters:
stream the data stream that can be used freely by the renderer.
virtual void sxsdk::renderer_interface::begin_rendering ( rendering_context_interface *  rendering_context,
stream_interface *  stream,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called when starting rendering.

Get scene info from rendering_context which is passed here.

Parameters:
rendering_context Rendering context. Used to get the scene info.
stream the data stream that can be used freely by the renderer.
virtual bool sxsdk::renderer_interface::can_ask ( void *  aux = 0  )  [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Returns whether or not the renderer plugin expects ask() function call.

If the function returns true, the Info. button of the rendering settings palette becomes active and a user can click it to call ask() function. When you override ask() function, you should override this function and return true.

virtual bool sxsdk::renderer_interface::must_clear_image ( void *  aux = 0  )  [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Returns whether or not the image should be cleared before rendering.

If not overridden, the image is cleared when starting rendering.

virtual bool sxsdk::renderer_interface::needs_z ( void *  aux = 0  )  [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Returns whether or not the Z value is needed.

When exporting the Z value, it is necessary to override and return true.

virtual void sxsdk::renderer_interface::render ( void *  aux = 0  )  [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Does the actual rendering calculation.

By calling rendering_context_interface::convert() in this function, the callback function for getting the object info is called. (Ref: exporter_interface)

You can access the proxy_shape_class virtual hierarchy structure after calling rendering_context_interface::convert() with the following functions.

rendering_context_interface::get_current_proxy_shape(), rendering_context_interface::get_root_proxy_shape()

virtual bool sxsdk::renderer_interface::uses_antialiasing ( void *  aux = 0  )  [inline, virtual]

virtual void sxsdk::renderer_interface::walkthrough ( sxsdk::scene_interface *  scene,
camera_interface *  camera,
sxsdk::image_interface *  image,
rendering_context_interface *  rc,
stream_interface *  stream,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called when doing walkthrough.

Parameters:
scene the target walkthrough scene
camera the target walkthrough camera
image the rendered image
rc rendering context
stream the data stream that can be used freely by the renderer.
